title: Stray bullet injures 6-year-old in Lower 9th Ward, police say
content:
A stray bullet hit a 6-year-old boy in the Lower 9th Ward on Sunday (Oct. 23), New Orleans Police said.
The boy was struck in the knee area and his injuries were not life-threatening, police said.
The shooting occurred in the 1400 block of Alabo Street in the Lower 9th Ward. New Orleans police sent out an alert about the incident at about 2:30 p.m.
One neighbor said he heard about 15 gunshots. Another neighbor said he heard "enough gunshots to make me get out bed and hit the floor." He then went outside and saw a boy who lives in the neighborhood hollering, "Daddy, daddy!" before a car drove him to the hospital.
No one answered the door Sunday evening where a neighbor said the boy lives.
The shooting was the second in New Orleans to injure a young child within the past week: An infant and two other people were shot in Algiers on Thursday night.
Five people were shot dead in New Orleans and one in Metairie the week that ended Sunday (Oct. 23).
